intro: Securidaca timboensis, commonly known as the African trumpet tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with alternate arrangement and produces small, round fruits that split open to release seeds. It is often found in woodland areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
